event: Earliest human presence in present-day Belgium
Celtic tribes inhabit the Low Countries
Roman conquest integrates the region into Gallia Belgica
Roman authority collapses during the Migration Period
Frankish rule incorporates the region into Carolingian Europe
Medieval towns flourish through trade and textiles
Burgundian Netherlands unite much of the region
Spanish Habsburg rule begins over the Southern Netherlands
Eighty Years’ War ends, dividing the Low Countries
Austrian Habsburgs gain control after the War of Spanish Succession
France annexes the region during the Revolutionary Wars
Belgium is merged with the Netherlands after Napoleon’s defeat
Belgium declares independence from the Netherlands
King Leopold II establishes control over the Congo Free State
German invasion draws Britain into World War I
Belgium is occupied by Nazi Germany in World War II
Belgium helps found postwar European cooperation
Belgium becomes a founding member of the European Economic Community
